english: I am learning Hebrew with Assimil (by-Assumil)

hebrew: לֹא רַק עִברִית. אֲנִי מִפּוֹלָניָה, אֲנִי מְדַבֵּר פּוֹלָנִית.٭
english: Not only Hebrew. I'm from Poland; I speak Polish.

hebrew: הוּא מֵרוּסיָה, הוּא מְדַבֵּר רוּסִית, אִידִישׁ וְעִברִית שֶׁל אוּלפָּן.٭
english: He is from Russia; he speaks Russian, Yiddish, and Ulpan Hebrew.

hebrew: רִנָה? הִיא מְדַבֶּרֶת עִברִית שֶׁל שַׁבָּת!٭

english: He is from Russia; he speaks Russian
She is from Poland; she speaks Polish.
We want a computer for our son.
He wants a computer with internet.
The son and the daughter want a computer.
Good evening.  What would you (f pl) like (want)?

hebrew: אֵין עוּגַת גבִינָה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ עוּגַת פֶּרֶג טוֹבָה.٭
english: There isn't any cheesecake, but there's a good poppyseed cake.

hebrew: יֵשׁ קָפֶה פִילטֶר, קָפֶה בּוֹץ, קָפֶה טוּרקִי, קָפֶה הָפוּך, וְנֵס קָפֶה.٭
english: There's filter coffee, unfiltered coffee, Turkish coffee, milky coffee, and instant coffee.
You (m pl) are drinking mud coffee?
What is there in the cafeteria?
You (f pl) are drinking instant coffee.

hebrew: אֲנִי לֹא קוֹנֶה, אֲבָל אִשׁתִי קוֹנָה וְהִיא לֹא עֲיֵפָה!٭
english: I'm not buying, but my wife is buying, and she isn't tired!

hebrew: הוא קונה, אבל היא לֹא קונה.٭
english: He buys, but she does not buy.
They (m) are talking on a cordless (wireless) phone.
They (f pl) are speaking on a mobile phone.
No problem.  There is a hands-free set in the car.
They are talking on a cordless telephone.
I want a hands-free set [phone?] in the car.
They [f pl] are talking on a mobile telephone.
Are you (m s) also in the mall?
I am buying a computer for my son and daughter.
I am buying (f) a mobile phone.

hebrew: אֲבָל אַת, רִנָה, מְדַבֶּרֶת עִברִית שֶׁל שַׁבָּת.٭
english: But you, Rinah, speak Shabbat Hebrew.

hebrew: אֲנִי עֲיֵפָה. אַתָה רוֹצֶה קָפֶה וְעוּגָה?٭
english: I (f) am tired. Do you (m s) want coffee and cake?

hebrew: אֵין בְּעָיָה. יֵשׁ בֵּית קָפֶה בַּקַניוֹן.٭
english: No problem. There is a cafe in the mall.
I (m) am coming from the beach.
In the morning I swim in the sea.
Are there hot chicks at the beach?
No, in the morning there aren't any hot chicks there.

hebrew: לֹא? אָז לָמָה אַתָה בַּיָם בַּבּוֹקֶר?٭
english: No? So why do you go to the sea in the morning?
Where are you coming from this (in the) morning?
There aren't any hot chicks on the beacb.
I am not at the beach.

hebrew: בְּקָרוֹב בַּר מִצוָה לִנְתַנאֵל בּנִי. אֲנִי בְּדִיאֶטָה.٭
english: It's my son Nethanel's Bar Mitzvah soon. I'm on a diet.

hebrew: אֲבָל אֲנִי לֹא מְבִינָה. לָמָה דִיאֶטָה לְבַר מִצוָה?٭
english: But I don't understand.  Why go on a diet for a Bar Mitzvah?

hebrew: אֲנִי בְּדִיאֶטָה כִּי אֲנִי רוֹצָה לִקנוֹת שִׂמלָה יָפָה לַבַּר מִצוָה שֶׁל נְתַנאֵל!٭
english: I'm on a diet because I want to buy a pretty dress for Nethanel's Bar Mitzvah!

hebrew: אני רוצה לקנות שמלה יפה לאשתי.٭
english: I want to buy a pretty dress.

hebrew: זֶה לֹא בַּלַגָן, אֲנִי מְסַדֵר אֶת הַחֶדֶר.٭
english: This isn't a mess.  I'm tidying my room!
This table here and these chairs there...
The messy guy clears up the room.
You're dressed up like a groom!
To 'The Marriage of Figaro' at the opera.

hebrew: הִיא הַסוֹפּרָנוֹ בָּאוֹפֶּרָה. אֲנִי הַבַּעַל שֶׁל אֲבִיבָה.٭
english: She is the soprano in the opera. I am Avivah's husband.
Why are you dressed up like at the opera?
How are you? Where are you going?

hebrew: עם מי הוא הולך לבית קפה?٭
english: With whom are you going to the café?
In the morning Dad plays football.
Mom plays tennis on the beach.

hebrew: אָחִי הַגָדוֹל וְאָחִי הַקָטָן מְשַׂחֲקִים כַּדוּריָד.٭
english: My big brother and my little brother play handball.

hebrew: אֲחוֹתִי הַגדוֹלָה וְאֲחוֹתִי הַקטָנָה מְשַׂחֲקוֹת כַּדוּרסַל.٭
english: My big sister and my little sister play basketball.
I play a video game at home.
My big sister is playing a video game.
The little sister and Mom play handball.
In the morning we swim in the pool.
In the evening we go to friends.
We chat and have a barbecue.
On the weekend you swim in the sea.
We go to the swimming pool with friends.
In the evening we have (eat) barbecue.
In the morning we chat on the telefone
